Reviews.Title: “UNWASHED SHEETS”
Reviews.Author: CalvinCyanghen
Reviews.Content: Do NOT be fooled by the pictures. Rusted locks and knobs, king = 2 twins put together, sheets with holes, unwashed sheets (found hairs between the flat sheet and the fitted sheets), the shower knob pulls right off (I had to take out a screw driver to fix it myself to shower), very thin walls, the breakfast is a joke. I booked it to save some money, but it was not worth the frustration. Do youself a favor and spend $20-30 more for a better night of sleep and a better mood for the rest of the day.

Reviews.Title: “misleading”
Reviews.Author: anita m
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel that i would advise that noone stays in. my husband and i stayed in this hotel(if you want to call it that) for the weekend. the lobby is very nice but that is all. there is supposed to be a restaurant on site that isnt even open for business. the staff claims its being renovated. when i looked inside the window there wasnt any renovations going on at all. my first complaint is the website. everything on the website is a Lie. there is no heated pool, there wasnt even any water in it. they claim they offer internet in your room. well that also is misleading because they told us you can only get interenet if you hang out in the lobby, or get a room on the first and second floor.the rooms were dirty we had to change rooms three times. In the elevators people were smoking cigarettes and marijuana. in one of the three rooms we were in i killed a roach that crawled up the wall. we had to ask for refrigerator and microwave and had to wait 2 and a half hours for, that was not clean at all. as for the alarm clocks, there are no clocks in the room. there is soo many complaints to type but please whoever reads this please do not get a room here. the staff were not even close to being professional. i took pictures of everything. On the morning of our departure the hotel lost power throughout the whole building. also there wasnt any running water. it took hours for them to get it fixed. again the staff offered no compensation for everything. i am now trying to get a refund for this horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the rating on here”
Reviews.Author: Kootenay23
Reviews.Content: Not the worlds greatest hotel, but was in reasonable shape. My one warning would be to check rates in advance. There ended up being a U2 concert on when I came here so the rates were much higher than what was listed on their website. Neighbourhood seemed ok when I walked and ran around it. The police did knock on my door the first night I was there (someone had thrown things out of a window), but I guess there can be rowdy people at any hotel. It took me a little over an hour to walk to downtown (some of it was very nice and colourful, some areas looked a little run down). I'd stay here again at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for sport arena's, horrible, dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cancun24
Reviews.Content: Only good thing about this hotel is the location to where the Phillies, Eagles and Flyers play. About a 20mins walk. 1st hotel room bathroom never flushed, faucets were broken. 2nd hotel room after we changed did not flush also and faucets were broken and carpet was very dirty. Beds are old and soft and smell. I was afraid of bed bugs. Regarding the free wireless internet "in the room" non existant! The front desk hung up on me when I asked why dont I have wireless internet. For wireless internet you had to go to the lobby. Picture, hell no, probably camera was going to break. Lucky for me, it was only 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: Maisha T
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice from the outside, and it probably used to look nice on the inside too a couple of decades ago. The very fancy name, the location and the overall appearance of the building tricked us into checking in this hotel as we were looking for a place for the night. The truth is, it's very very old and nobody has ever bothered renovating the rooms. The room we were in smelled like humidity, everything was very old and very nasty. There was no cable TV nor internet. Half the lights had no light bulbs. The ice machines and the vending machines were out of order. 2 elevators out of 3 were out of order. In the bathroom, the plumbing was very old. The toilet was leaking and the water rose from the bowl and flood the bathroom. The shower curtain was nasty. The ceiling was destroyed and had holes in it with gunk dropping from it, absolutely disgusting. Save yourself the headache and most of all save your money !!

Reviews.Title: “Lice”
Reviews.Author: jack v
Reviews.Content: My brother and I planned to stay here one evening, only to be welcomed by a cigarette burnt blanket and lice. Upon discovering the lice within the shower, we immediately packed up and headed downstairs. When we demanded a refund we were verbally assaulted by the owner and two facility workers. Thankfully after waiting on-hold for over an hour with hotels.com we were able to secure our refund. I would never come back. Hopefully it is torn down by the time I return to Philly.

Reviews.Title: “A lot better than most of these reviews...”
Reviews.Author: Dna103
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night while attending a concert downtown. I read reviews that made it sound like a horror but I couldn't cancel so I hoped for the best. Yes it was old and the decor was def. outdated but other than that it was perfectly fine for a short stay. Our room was 1506 we had a nice view of the jersey skyline and it was clean. We ripped apart the bedding to check for bedbugs and did not see any sign of them. Toilet was really junky though. The Pennrose Diner across the street is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Deception, illusion, room looks more like a motel, and wifi is very very slow”
Reviews.Author: R T
Reviews.Content: I give this a 1 star if that. This was a last minute booking over the phone and had to stay one night. Unfortunately for us the night we had to stay, most of the the hotels were booked due to something going on that evening. As soon as I walked in the odor was not pleasant. Waited in the reception area for a very long time as there was only one person in the reception desk. Front desk was not very professional either. Elevator is very slow and there was only one elevator working that night. We got in our room and some electrical parts of the room was not working. The only lights that were working was the bathroom and one lamp. The lights by the bedroom was not working either. The thing that upset me the most is that wi-fi was very important to me that night as I was working on a deadline. The hotels internet connection was slower than dial-up. It was stuck for most of the time I was online. I could not do what I needed to do. The room looks very old and below par. We left within an hour. Did not stay that night and when I tried to get a refund the manager was dishonest about our stay. He/she said we stayed over night. Please do not stay here. You will be very dissapointed. There are other comparable hotels close by,

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Eric A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here October 29, 2011 in room 604 and I'm not sure how people can write good reviews for this place. The front desk staff was friendly enough but it went quickly downhill from there. After checking in, I push the button for the elevator and I waited, and waited, and waited some more. The floor indicator on the elevator on the right was moving and so that was at least a good sign but the left didn't seem to be working. Another young man had checked in and was waiting for the elevator as well before it finally got to the ground floor. When I actually got onto the elevator, I noticed why it took so long, and probably why the left side elevator wasn't working...the thing was as rickety as I've ever seen. When the doors opened on the 6th floor, it lurched a bit to actually get in position as I could see that there was an inch or two of separation between the elevator and the floor. So I step into the hall and quickly find my room. The hallway and the room door had a very "dungeon-esque" feel to it. This feeling was confirmed when I actually opened the door and it creaked like some cheesy horror flick movie. The switch plate just inside the door seemed like it was about to fall off (not a big deal). The bathroom was absolutely DISGUSTING! I didn't want to take my shoes off but I kinda had to in order to take a shower, the floor was filthy. I took the liberty of cleaning part of it and I took some pictures and video of before and after (look for the YouTube video if I don't get my money back for this stay).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marsha62
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the north side of the building in room 1208, so we had an amazing view of the city of Philadelphia. Front desk staff was very professional and courteous, as was the head of maintenance (just happened to meet him in the elevator). Hotel and room/bath were clean. Breakfast was served in a cozy dining room from 6 to 10am, and consisted of hot coffee (regular and decaf), hot tea, orange juice, blueberry muffins, corn muffins (muffins were great, and individually wrapped), bread, butter, a toaster, a microwave, corn flakes, cheerios, and milk. All items were fresh and tasty, and an attendant was on hand to refill/clean, etc. Hotel staff even arranged for their courtesy van to drop us 6 or 8 blocks away at the subway station (just a 30-minute ride to Market St.) after check-out, since it was raining, and we asked. Hotel obviously has some age to it, and must have been very posh in it's heyday (marble floors, walls in lobby, etc.); with just a little TLC it could be again. Our room was just $95 + tax, less than half of others in the city since this was a last minute reservation. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ewwww!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lanelane81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and It looked ok in the front but beware they have a roach problem!!! I had to tie my bags up extra tight so I wouldn't take none home.When I told the front desk they just shrugged me off and that elevator had me saying the last prayer it had me scared.Ice machine loud as hell and don't work no water in a dirty pool(it was summer)I could go on and on Here's my advice don't do it!!Â¡!!!

Reviews.Title: “UGH!!!!! DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NIVEA S
Reviews.Content: The ONLY thing nice about this hotel is the apperance from the outside. Went to take a shower and saw a ROACH crawling up the shower curtin. My ice bucket was dirty, the carpet feels sticky and WORST of all they have BED BUGS i woke up the next morning with 2 bug bites!!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy and old”
Reviews.Author: mallatrone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. The personnel is helpful and friendly. But the hotel is dirty. Rooms are not well cleaned. Furniture is old. And wi-fi is only available in a noisy lobby. Price is too high for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Your Own Risk!!!”
Reviews.Author: Naomi F
Reviews.Content: Ugh! The hotel seemed okay at first. We weren't in need of anything spectacular, just a few clean beds to sleep in for a few nights while my fiance, his dad and his brother went to the U2 concert. We slept there one night and then the next day my fiance and I had bed bug bites all over our bodies (mostly clustered on our arms and legs - my face was horrible with a huge amount of bites on my forehead). It was absolutely terrible! My future in-laws were okay, but they were sleeping in a different bed and my future brother-in-law was on the couch. Needless to say after that mess we left that day and didn't stay the second night.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here! Don't see what people expect on this site.”
Reviews.Author: Paras0
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean, friendly, and highly recommended. Surprised to see so many bad ratings on here. wow. Definitely would come back...well worth the price. Trust me.

Reviews.Title: “An old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cris66Jesi_Italia
Reviews.Content: It's cheap but it's also dirty, We had booked one bedroom with an extra bed but the room wasn't ready, The breakfast is really poor, served on plastic glasses, The elevator smells badly and it makes strange noises,Anyway we had a room on the 15Â° floor and we had a wonderful view in Phillie skyline. The hotel is really close to the bus stop to go dontown.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the heads up”
Reviews.Author: Billmartin16
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a stadium hotel site I found, the reviews weren't bad. I found these and my stomach dropped. I called the hotel and sure enough the bar isn't open because they have no bar tender. Luckily, the hotel allowed me to cancel and I received a full refund on my credit card. Thanks to all who wrote good honest reviews,

Reviews.Title: “Such an experience...”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak1948
Reviews.Content: It was, to say the least, a unique travel experience to spend five nights in these swank South Philly accommodations, which feature an empty swimming pool. Service was minimalist no bellhops falling all over themselves to carry our luggage, no working telephone to call room service. When we needed an extra towel, we had to pick it up at reception. The room, which was comfortably large, overlooked the Philadelphia skyline and an oil refinery. It was also smoke free, despite the cigarette burns in one of the blankets. The bathroom had a number of special features, including hot and hot running water. I had only experienced this on a kibbutz near the Dead Sea. The toilet flushed, but not with pride. In recompense, the tank was warm and sitters enjoyed mini-saunas. Matters went seriously down hill when the room cleaner clogged the toilet completely, which necessitated repeated visits to reception (no working telephone, remember?) to roust someone from maintenance. The breakfast buffet was Spartan, coffee, orange juice, cereal, immortal cellophane-wrapped muffins with no consume-by date and surprisingly good white bread for toasting. Despite the rough edges, the Skyview Plaza had the advantages of being relatively inexpensive and close to the neighborhood we intended to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Jeevs7
Reviews.Content: My experience at the hotel was very good. Everything was very clean, the staff was friendly and courteous, and the room was comfortable to stay in. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, I had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel Plus Double Billing”
Reviews.Author: Linda L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Skyview Plaza one night. The desk staff was great. The managment has been totally non-responsive!! My credit card was billed the day we checked out and was again billed the following week. I have e-mailed and written to the management, as well as leaving three phone messages, requesting that the duplicate charge be removed from my credit card. I have received no response. The room was O.K., but the hotel is basically a dump--no pool, no restaurant, in the middle of no where. I would never stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Roach motel”
Reviews.Author: fuji38dd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this nasty hotel a few days ago first of all the services they advertise are untrue like a pool with no water,broken elevater,ice machine broken, and house keepin service sucks my room was not clean at all my carpet was not done and my drapes had holes in it ,and to top it off no internet. Yes folks i did say something all they did was write it down and i did takes a picture of the bugs. So my advise stay at your own risk

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER BEEN IN MY LIFE”
Reviews.Author: Emeka M
Reviews.Content: Hall ways were smelling badly and with no air conditioner. Inside the room, the mattress and the box spring were tore up, raggady, and old. There was no microwave oven, no iron and ironing board and worst of all no refrigerator. Breakfast was awful. I got stuck in the elevator twice. Over all it was a horrible experience. I hurriedly checked out the following morning for a better hotel. The whole building need to be closed down for a complete detailed renovation or demolish the whole building. The only positive thing about Skyview is that they have ample parking and neighborhood seems to be safe. I will not recommend this hotel to any decent human being.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: Kayohhh
Reviews.Content: Some of you people must be some rich, stuck up people. I find nothing wrong at all with this hotel. The service people were really kind, especially the cleaning people. It was not in a questionable part of the neighborhood like someone said. There was actually NO bugs at all, and no bed bugs. I know a special place to check for them and there wasn't any. The shower was so nice and relaxing. There was a lot of little nice shops close by. Just turn left leaving the hotel and drive down a little and they're there. The main reason I stayed here was it was cheap, and I was here for the Phillies game. If you turn left leaving the hotel, and drive straight for five minutes, there is CBP! Yeah, there was a little bit of stains on the floor, the elevator was slow (NOT SHAKEY), a couple holes in the blanket, and there wasn't a shower curtain when we got there, but ladies and gentlemen, this isn't the Ritz Carlton. Overall, this was a nice hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place, never go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeleKiboston
Reviews.Content: This place is so dirty, and the service is awful. They charge you for being careless and rude. They moved our stuff out without checking our reservation. Breakfast is miserable. Internet doesn't work except in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Bates Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Coconutmocha
Reviews.Content: First of all the elevator was broken when I stayed and I had to carry my luggage up 7 flights of stairs. The shower only ran freezing cold water. Also the cabinets were falling off and there were bed bugs. The lights were flicking and I did not feel safe. The bed did not feel clean and the whole hotel smelled like cigarette smoke. At any price this place would not be a good deal it was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay if no where else to go”
Reviews.Author: guzmicha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here due to no availability in the Center City area. # 1 could not get a room before 3 pm. End of Story. #2 No Wi-Fi not working on the 15th Floor. only in the lobby. My work is online so big problem. #3 Lobby looks acceptable, but the rooms ugly not too clean, Ripped and shabby looking Quilts used to dress the beds. #4 Indian Owners live in the building, but absolutely no attention to any type of detail, and forget about any actual Customer Service. #5 Was switched to another room with working Wi-Fi, but the hotel is lousy elevator floors presence, presentation of each room is very very bad. #6 Was told neighborhood is not good to walk around. Deserted type of area, only highways. Only a decent Diner directly in front. #7 Sketchy Lowest denominator type of help at this hotel mostly except Victor son of Owner and 2 or 3 of the other front desk guys/gals. But zero understanding about service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel.com should be ashamed of themselves for suggesting this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vazman
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel room for an overnight stay and what I got was a disgusting and nasty experience. Sheets were soiled, bathroom was dirty and the room smelled like he'll warmed over. I should have taken notice of the empty in ground pool with mildew growing on the pool walls. Skyview Hotel, do us all a favor and close your doors and make that place a halfway home or something. Hotel.com....Shame on you...

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting slum hole.”
Reviews.Author: JerryCim
Reviews.Content: 1) Feces in toilet uppon arrival. 2) Pillow had some one elses cologne on it. 3) Hair in the bed. 4) Cigarette burns on headboard 5) Cigarette ash in the draw. 6) Running, noisy toilet. 7) sticky, dried up drink in the common area. Without a doubt the most disgusting and vile place i have ever stayed. Switching places immediatly.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Poor Amenities, Nothing Worked, Poor Service!”
Reviews.Author: coolguy60
Reviews.Content: Travel led with Friend, two guys, to this hotel in early May 2011. Ive stayed in some poor hotels and if you are looking for a hotel that is cheap ($75 per night) and close to the Philadelphia sports complex (our reason for staying there), then this is the hotel for you. Otherwise, this is a very crappy hotel. First off, the elevator was quite rickety, unsafe for sure. In room phone did not work, stayed for two days, voiced our concerns to the front desk, never made any effort to help us out. No continental breakfast, no ESPN or any good channels on tv, no pool, in a very questionable area of Philadelphia. If you are going to an Eagles,Phillies, or Flyers game and are on a tight budget and willing to put up with low service (ie.none), then this might be the hotel for you. I would deffinetely not stay here again, thats for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Not even if it were free!”
Reviews.Author: IA_LDconsultant
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4-night stay for a conference in Philly. The only positive experience I had was on the shuttle ride to the Hotel, which was timely with a courteous driver. However, my fellow passenger and I had a rude shock when we walked into the crowded lobby, where about 25 guests were all waiting for the hotel staff to find clean rooms and issue key cards. there were (3) staff working the desk, but only one computer could be used at a time to process reservations and issue rooms. There was no Manager on duty, and I heard one staffer indicate to another guest that the Managers would not be on-site until the following week after 9AM! For a sold-out property during a peak period in Philly, it is unbelievable that no management would be on-site. After FINALLY getting to the desk (90 minutes later), I was issued a room which turned out, after a slow and sticky ride up the tiny elevator, to be uncleaned from an earlier guest. There were towels everywhere, unmade bed, phone cords missing, headboard ripped out of the wall, and beer cans all over. The corridors smelled musty, and I knew at this moment that I could not accept even an alternate room (none was available). Upon returning to the crowd in the lobby, I was told that they would have someone clean the room for me (right), although during the next 1/2 hour while I phoned around looking for alternate lodging, the sole housekeeper came thru the lobby on her way home, chatting with another staffer and indicating that she was done for the day and was the last one on site. The stale-beer smell of the lobby furniture only spurred me in my efforts to get out of there! I ended up getting a cancellation receipt from one of the clerks who was very courteous and clearly unable to solve the hotel's troubles. I ran out, caught a cab to the airport Hampton Inn, and never looked back! The website imagery and claims regarding services and amenities are misleading at best. PLEASE consider staying in the train station before you book at this one...!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again.....”
Reviews.Author: duffacheryl
Reviews.Content: After being stuck at airport and all other hotels books we checked into the Skyview. The shuttle driver was a nice helpful guy. But it ended there. My trip was to take my sister to visit a relative in bad health and fianances were an issue. Since this hotel was the only one available I had to choice but to fortk out $200 for a room. Imagine my surprise when I see that online the rooms start at $75! This was probably a nice hotel at one time but not anymore. Ceilings peeling, beds old and uncomfortable as well as badly made (sheets didn't fit). Room was NOT clean. The lobby was the nicest part of the hotel although the sweet girl at the desk didn't have a clue......No discounts for AAA or AARP. Sad ending to a nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “hotel aka brothel”
Reviews.Author: chill636
Reviews.Content: this is my first review and feel the need to express to everyone how disgusting this hotel is. My husband and i were stranded in Philly for the night due to a flight delay. The rate seemed to increase at this motel due to supply and demand. It looks like a 1970's dumphouse. The elevator would not close and my husband had to bang and push the doors to get them to move. Our room smelled of mold and there were water stains all over the carpet. There was a hole DRILLED into the door as a makeshift peephole and the bathroom doors seemed to be coming off the hinges. I immediately inspected for bed bugs and refused to put our luggage on the floor. There were drunk couples coming in and out of the hotel and the staff seemed to be high school drop outs. everything including the layout, interior decorating and furniture appeared to be worn out and out dated. I felt so uncomfortable at this hotel that i slept with my clothes ON! I would never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AWFUL.”
Reviews.Author: Msgloves
Reviews.Content: Disgusting is too soft of a word to use to describe this Pitt of a hotel.I'm not sure ho any body could have a good experience here. To the holiday inn we go.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: AtlanticTravelgal
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Skyview after being stranded at the Philadelphia airport. The shuttle driver provided some much needed entertainment, as we drove around and around the airport. I was checked in quickly. When I entered the first room, it smelled of bad perfume, but the toilet was dirty and would not flush. I requested another room. Room #2- Was freezing and had puddles of water all over the bathroom floor. When I called the front desk, they said they would send someone up. About 15 minutes later, a knock on the door. It was the shuttle driver with a mop! He cleaned up the floor, but could not find the leak. I requested another room. Room #3- there was a do not disturb sign on the door. After I went back down to the front desk, they assured me that the room was empty. I entered the room, and everything seemed fine. Until, I saw the cockroach crawling across the ceiling! I immediately insisted that someone bring me back to the airport. They agreed to this. But when I asked about a refund, I was told only management could arrange this and they were gone for night. And they may or may not refund me. On the drive back to the airport, the front desk called the shuttle driver. When he told them that he was trying to drop me off at the correct terminal, he was told to drop me off anywhere and to NOT go "the extra mile" for me. When I called about the refund in the morning, it was not a problem. The manager listened to the problems and apologized. So, the shuttle drivers and management were great. But I would never go back and I would deter anyone from staying here based on the lack of customer service at the front desk and the rooms because I never want to bring any bugs home!

Reviews.Title: “Never go back”
Reviews.Author: traveller30242
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to visit Philly and stayed at Skyview for 1 day. We arrived there on Saturday morning and the receptionist was really kind gave us a lot of clues... and we left our luggage there he required a name tag with a code, because we were supposed to show it to get the luggage back. We came back at 4:45pm to start our check in and we asked for the receptionist (it was another person) to take our luggage she did not ask for name tags and told us to get into and take our luggage, so it was not safe we could take any one. We had to check in at 3pm we arrived at 4:45pm and no rooms available for us and no WiFi working. we waited for almost an hour and they provided a stinky room for us. We required a non-smoking one but it was smelling cigaret and we went down to talk to the helpdesk lady and she told us she couldn't do anything. She was very very busy and many guests arriving and other complaining. So, I asked to talk to the manager she told me he was in a meeting and ignored me for 30 minutes and then I was strong with her and told her that i needed to talk to him because we could't stay in that room. It was durty and stinky and the elevator and that hall and room were smelling cigaret. She added that the guests request non-smoking room but it is not certain to have a non-smoking room , so she admitted they have different points of view, the website and the hotel, what they sell and what they really have there. We had a problem with the driver who came trying to help his co-worker and treated us very bad told us that she was doing her best but she had a lot of things to do... Maybe 2 hours later we had our non-smoking and clean room. No WiFi at all, they didn't tell us about breakfast, asked for more blankets and they didn't have enough and the hotel is not that close and not that cheap to have so many problems. So, I think there are different stuff and when it is crowded it is worse and I think who says that didn't like there are telling the truth some are lucky and some face the reality. I will never recommend that hotel to any one, Because I didn't feel they care about guests there.

Reviews.Title: “No room adminities, no breakfast, holes in the comforter, no room clock, no resturanut when it was stated there was one”
Reviews.Author: celtics86
Reviews.Content: the transportation was great from the airport to the hotel, our drivers were safe and courteous, but the vechiles were in very bad condition, the steering was going, the vans made a lot of squeaking noises when running. The front desk was very helpful and nice. The rooms were run down and not very clean. The comforter had holes all over it but the sheets seemed clean. One of the towels in the bathroom was damp when we went to use it-was supposed to be clean. The room/hall/elevators reeked of cigarettes, even though we requested a non smoking room. It was like they put a non smoking sign in the room because we requested non smoking. We did not even have a clock/alarm in the room. The resturaunt/bar was apparently being "renovated" even though there was nothing listed on the website. There was also no breakfast service-atleast that we were told about, even though the hotel website states that there is. The elevators barely worked. I thought we were going to get stuck in them. The walls were very thin and we heard everyone that walked by. The alarms went off in the middle of the night. I would not go back or advise anyone to go back just because of the condition of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: ricksmith1993
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were attending the Philadelphia 76ers game in Philadelphia and I noticed the prices at the Holiday Inn were a bit expensive, so I figured why not try out this non franchise hotel. I can assure you it was the best decision I made. The staff at the hotel treated me as if I was a guest in their home. The restaurant in the hotel was incredible, the food was cooked to perfection and I couldn't ask for a better meal. The room was in perfection condition and there was nothing wrong at all. Also, the furniture on the floor by the elevator was very unique and it looked foreign. The bathrooms looked newly renovated as there were granite tiles and counter tops. I can honestly say this is the most underrated hotel in all of Philadelphia, I travel to Philadelphia once a month and it was my first time staying here. From now on I will be staying here because it provides the best service and has the best rooms. I cannot wait to come back here again. !

Reviews.Title: “Sky way to hell”
Reviews.Author: Dacia20
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed nice enough upon first entering... what a hoax. After taking a creepy elevator that barely made it off the first floor, my roomies and I arrived to a freezing cold room where the the toliet and heat didn't work. So of course we called for another room. The guy helping us seemed to be in over his head as he was constantly recieving calls from other complaining customers. He told us that he was the shuttle driver and security gaurd and he was only person covering the desk because I guess every one else left?? Anyways.... An hour later we were taken to a new room that was now burning hot. My friends pulled the cover of their bed back only to find hair, a dead bug, and blood! We immediately called the guy again who tried to act like this was not a problem, and even denied that it was blood. "It's just makeup" he insisted. He eventually came back with a different set of sheets, that i'm pretty sure he just pulled off another bed, because they didn't even fit correctly. The next morning I found out that my friend had been bitten by a beg bug that night. When we closely examined the bed we saw two bed bugs crawling around. We left immediately to go to where we should have in the first place.. the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE...Bed Bugs, Dirty Pillows and Blood Stained Sheets”
Reviews.Author: SuperAja
Reviews.Content: Found bed bugs when I pulled back the sheets and a big blood stain. The hotel worker guy actually argued that it wasn't blood, it was "make-up" as if women can't tell the difference between blood and makeup. Also be careful on the hotel elevators, they shake and hesitate to open. Disgusting place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service, will stay with them everytime”
Reviews.Author: decafb1
Reviews.Content: When I heard the forecast for icy and freezing rain the day of my flight from Philadelphia I decided to book a hotel for the night before so I would risk driving to the airport in bad weather.. I chose the park/'fly package at the Skyview and I was really happy I did.. I even had WIFI in my nicely appointed room. The service was lovely, they chauffeured me to and from the terminal promptly (it was a quick trip, even in rush hour) and the price was less than if I had only parked for the same 10 days- even at the cheaper off-site places. My car was in a covered spot and I didn't have to worry about it starting after 10 days away. I was surprised to find complementary breakfast the morning of my departure since I didn't remember it being listed as an amenity. I think this hotel is an undiscovered gem and I definitely recommend it- it can't be beat for value and service.

Reviews.Title: “This place is not nearly as bad as the reviews indicate!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnandJaneS
Reviews.Content: OK, so its not a 5 star hotel. But for the price (we paid under $100/night) its a great deal. I booked it because the rate was right and because they offered free parking with an overnight stay plus breakfast and a shuttle to the airport. Since we were taking a 3+ week trip I asked them whether I could stay one night at each end of my trip and get free parking for the entire three weeks, and they said "yes". They were the only hotel I called that would agree to this so I booked it, although I had second thoughts due to the terrible reviews. The place is obviously old and a bit run down. However its being fixed up. The lobby is actually quite nice and our first room was very nice as well. On our return trip the room was a little shabby, but all we wanted was a good nights' sleep and we got that. The elevators are old and have been redone with plywood walls. Pretty yucky, but they work. The halls and stairwells are dim and grubby, but not dirty.....although they do smell of cigarette smoke. The large roomy non smoking rooms we had were clean and did not smell. No hot dogs or condoms on the floors (!) and no bedbugs or roaches as mentioned in some of the reviews!!! The extra large rooms were great because we had a lot of luggage for our trip and needed to spread out and reorganize it. The mattresses are very firm......just as we like them. If you want a pillow top mattress stay somewhere else! The staff was not particularly elegant and refined. just ordinary local folks. But they were all polite, helpful, and seemed eager to please and happy that we were there. The continental breakfast was simple but it was fine for us and saved us the cost of breakfast. An added bonus is that there is a 24 hour restaurant, The Penrose Diner, right across the street. It is big, bright and friendly, and has an extensive menu and good food. Its always busy (even at 4 AM when we went in after our trip because we had jet lag). The local police eat there all the time, so you knowits safe. Our car was parked in the hotels' brightly lit parking lot for a little over 3 weeks and it was fine when we returned. All in all I think this place is worth every penney we paid and I would recommend it if all you want is a place to spend the night in comfort and security.

Reviews.Title: “THERE WERE SEVERAL HAIRS IN MY BED! DISGUSTING HOTEL. RUN DOWN IN EVERY POSSIBLE WAY!”
Reviews.Author: ckr123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is filthy from top to bottom. The elevators don't work properly and the bathroom is dirty. My bed had several hairs in it. I slept in my clothes. There was nothing clean about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Should be condemned ...... NOW !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loola2010
Reviews.Content: Sent to this hell-hole by US Airways after they cancelled my flight from Philadelphia to San Francisco at 12.30am, following a 12 hour journey from Europe. Have NEVER seen anything like this place before and thought it only existed in a Slasher Movie !!! Opened the bedroom door and my boots immediately stuck to the carpet !! Air conditioner/heating unit had two cockroaches , who had been fried on it possibly several months before. The bed cover was just too suspect to even touch but pulled the cover off to reveal one sheet, no blanket and who knows what was living under the sheets !!! One lamp for light which I left on all night to deter any bugs etc., from coming out of the corners of the room during the night !! Had to put my suitcase on top of the chair so as not to place it on the filthy bed cover or the even dirtier carpet. Wallpaper peeling off the walls everywhere because of huge damp patches on the ceiling. Pure exhaustion made me sleep ( with all my clothes on ) in this disgusting place !! Ran out of there the minute I woke up and felt like my skin was crawling !!! Would NEVER, EVER recommend this place to anybody, EVER !!!!!!!! US Airways should be ashamed of themselves for sending their customers, who they inconvenience, to this dump !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: timessquarenyc
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I didn't know what to expect - but I chose the hotel because of it's price and the proximity to the Wells Fargo Center (formely Wachovia Center). The hotel is definately dated - but for $86.00 total I didn't expect luxury. There was a big dead opossum in the parking lot when we arrived. Like the past reviews said the ice maker did not work & the 2nd elevator bank is very scary. One side of the tower offers great views - However, the view on our side was terrible. The room was spacious (two double beds, table, two chairs, TV set, dresser, ceiling to wall mirrors). The staff was very friendly. They allowed us to check-in early at no additional fee. They recommended restaurants for us to try, etc. After the front desk staff told us that the hotel shuttle was only to bring guests to & from the airport - the manger stepped in on his own & went above-and-beyond by offering to take us to the restaurant - and then going one-step further by offering to pick us up later that evening after the concert - which was great because it was so late. My toothpaste was confiscated by TSA - which I forgot about until we got back to the hotel in the early A.M. hours - the front desk gave me two things of toothpaste & a new toothbrush at no charge (the Crowne Plaza I stayed at the week before charged for both) I recommend this hotel due to it's proximity to all the stadiums - but I recommend it even more for the great service provided by it's dedicated staff. If you're looking for more than a place to crash - you probably wouldn't be happy here - but for $86.00 - it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but not very clean”
Reviews.Author: 123countrygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it is just blocks away from the Wachovia Center where we had concert tickets and the reviews were decent. It was also inexpensive. ( Across the street is a great and very popular diner, the Penrose Restaurant/ Diner.) The lobby is attractive at the hotel but the rooms left a lot to be desired as far as cleanliness. The first thing I checked was the bed...clean sheets but a dirty bedspread...and no blanket! So even though I stripped off the bedspread initially I ended up putting it back on the bed in the middle of the night because I had the air on low and it was cold with just a sheet. The bathroom was ok, not super, and the bed was comfortable. But the carpet and table tops were dirty and stained as was the chair. Overall, as long as the bed sheets were clean...and no bed bugs!... we were willing to stay. The options for rooms under $100 are apparently limited in the area and not knowing the city at all we went by the reviews. I guess it can be said you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Only worth it if you really, really want free internet, parking, and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: chinoagl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a night because I had to take an exam in the area. We picked this hotel because it was the best price we found for a place not far from the downtown exam site and it had everything we were looking for without additional charges: parking, internet, and breakfast. This was the good part. Oh, and I will say that most of the employees greeted me and were nice. Now the bad part: yes, what all the other negative reviews say was confirmed when we got there. The comforter had multiple cigarette burns in our non-smoking room, the fitted sheet was not fitted, the room was dingy and not as clean as one would wish, our t.v. didn't have a remote and when we asked for one it didn't work, there was some goo and a public hair on the phone, the pool was void of water and cordoned off, etc. This we could put up with for one night, but what really upset us was that someone kept calling our room, acting like an employee of the hotel (which we confirmed he wasn't) and trying to get us to leave our phone live and off the hook. Was he trying to hear us have sex or something? No idea, but when the front desk couldn't or wouldn't do anything about it, we had to disconnect the phone. That was pretty disconcerting. So if you are looking for a hotel that is close to downtown and has free internet, parking, and breakfast, this is the place, but be ready for a shady experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, even if it's for free!”
Reviews.Author: Btaz262
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviewer[s], we were stuck here thanks to the incompetent employees at the Philadelphia International Airport.. Earlier in the day, [August 22, 2010], there were bad electrical storms in the Philadelphia area. Because of this, there was a skeleton crew working at the airport. My family and I arrived at the airport from Cancun and had to claim our bags, clear customs and re-check our bags to make our connecting flight to Providence, RI. Once we cleared customs we were directed to a US Airways ticket counted downstairs. Once there we waited in a long line and were told that our flight was delayed until midnight. That was fine because it was only 10:30 PM. We were then told that we wouldn't be able to board the flight because US Airways had sent the baggage handlers home and there were no TSA Agents to screen our bags, or us. Again this was at 10:30 PM in a so-called International Airport in the United States. Are you kidding me? So, our flight left without us. We were given boarding passes for the following afternoon as well as a hotel voucher to the Skyview Plaza Hotel & Suites. Well, it sure sounded nice.... yeah, right. Like the others, we waited over an hour as we watched the two small-overcrowded shuttle vans drive past us over and over again. Once we were finally picked-up by the disgruntled employee, we were shuttled to the hotel. Two of the three clerks had no type of uniform whatsoever. Opened shirts with hairy chests and gold rope chains exposed. They looked like porno actors from the 1970's. I was delirious at this point laughing out loud as I thought, "You can't make this stuff up." I felt like I was in a Candid Camera or Punked episode. One clerk, a younger kid was neatly dressed and courteous. Luckily that's who I dealt with. Anyway...we were checked into room #1503. Once I opened the door the odor hit me. Kinda like the odor of a men's room in a third world country soccer stadium. The so-called air conditioner was on, but blowing warm stale air. It obviously hadn't had a Freon refrigerant re-charge since around 1988. The carpet was filthy, and the comforters were ripped and riddled with cigarette burns. The windows were screwed shut and as I looked out the window I noticed that the outdoor pool was drained and barricaded with that yellow crime scene tape. God only knows what went on there. Needless to say we checked out as soon as we woke up from our night in the urine/smoky sweatbox room. I will say that the bathroom looked like it was recently remodeled and looked kinda clean with the exception of the odor. This place really should be on TripAdvisor's top 10 list of filthiest hotels. US Airways should reconsider sending displaced passengers to this hotel. I agree with the other reviewer; the only way this place stays in business is because of displaced passengers from the Philadelphia Airport. The Philadelphia Board of Health should inspect this place. After this experience I will avoid the Philadelphia Airport as well as US Airways. I certainly will never return to the Skyview Plaza Hotel & Suites.

Reviews.Title: “A. Totally Gross B. Hot and Stuffy C. Disgusting Beds / Sheets / Bathrooms, D. All of the above”
Reviews.Author: cfol819
Reviews.Content: The answer is D. All of the above. My friends and I stayed at this hotel because we had to catch a flight out of Philadelphia. Unfortunately, we didn't do our research. We found this hotel online and booked it because it was affordable and provided free parking and shuttle service to the airport. BIG MISTAKE. We arrived, checked in and headed to the room. First, the elevator on the right was out of service. Then, we got to the room to discover a filthy room with stains and an overflowing toilet. A random man knocked on the door and told us we would be moved to a room down the hall. Well that room was not any better. I was hesitant to even sit on the stained, tacky chair in the room. Clock didn't work, bathroom probably wasn't cleaned EVER, gross carpet, etc. We didn't dare shower there so we tried to just sleep. There was no chance we were putting our bodies near the comforters so we just laid there without moving, as we were certain there were bedbugs and we didn't want to rub against the sheets. Oh did I mention the dried blood stains on the sheets? We couldn't stand it anymore and left in the middle of the night because it was a better option to go sleep sitting upright at the freezing cold airport terminal. DO NOT STAY HERE. You are better off sleeping in your car, or on a sidewalk in Philly.

Reviews.Title: “Would you like to be upgraded to a Bloody Handprint?”
Reviews.Author: keleig819
Reviews.Content: THIS PLACE IS DISGUSTING!!!! My friends and I stayed there just for the night before our trip to Cancun and let me tell you that we didn't even make it the whole night!!! To start off, the employees at the front desk were none to helpful. We get to our room only to find what looked like a murder scene !..There was literally a bloody handprint on the wall!!! And to boot the toilet had some kind of "snakeskin" floating around in it, it was flushed and overflowed..So we get moved to another room only to find dried blood stains on the sheets..We couldn't even stand to be there for one night..Packed up our stuff and left at 3 am...Someone needs to call the board of health on this hotel, because it is an absolute SCUMHOLE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Who Could Possibly Find Anything Positive about This Place?”
Reviews.Author: MF012356
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting in my room as I write this. No clock. No room service. "Our restaurant is closed for renovation!". Ugly carpets Mis-matched linens. A Bathroom that would be a microbiologist's dream come true. Musty smell. Room was HOT when I arrived here. Terrible neighborhood. Soda Machines are in Lobby. I asked for change and the girl at the desk said "I only have 1 ten and I need that.". So I didn't get change for the soda machine. The only thing in the area that will deliver is Dominos. I'll just wait till I get back to the airport, Thank you. Avoid the elevator! Got on; punched 2. Went to ten without the door opening. Went back down to 2. Didn't think the door was going to open. This place is a DIVE!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to drink yourself to death or bring a prostitute”
Reviews.Author: mireilled1
Reviews.Content: Ugly, smelly, tacky, hot, itchy bedspreads, drunk, shirtless guests smoking in the lobby and the ELEVATOR. I was sent there by US Airways after a cancellation and refused to stay after seeing the room.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable and affordable hotel in Philly”
Reviews.Author: DX_Hunter
Reviews.Content: This property met my needs to provide affordable lodging in Philadelphia which had free parking and easy access to transit. The hotels in Center City are frightfully expensive and parking is even more so. My 5-night stay was relatively pleasant but there were some issues. This is an interesting place. It is a 16 story circular tower â€“ quite interesting architecture. It has changed franchises several times in the last few years. I reserved the room under Motel 6, but it was an American Best Value Inn and Days Inn and several other names before that. The ownership is trying to go alone as an independent now. Curious about the frequent name changes, I called up some personal friends of mine in Philly to ask about this property. Some said it was a dump and to stay away. But others said it was fine. I really didnâ€™t know what to expect and hoped for the best! My priorities in reviewing a property are that it has to be clean and the stuff (i.e. A/C, heat, Internet, TV) has to work and the staff has to be willing to help out with any issues. I found this property to be acceptably clean in the room, bath and hallways. The stuff mostly worked. The first night, the Internet did not work at all anywhere in the building. I reported this to the day manager and she had staff reset the system, which fixed it in the lobby. But still, no Internet in the room. I was told that there was a storm the week before which might have damaged the system. I did a quick check and found that the Internet worked on the other side of the building. The staff was helpful in letting me change rooms. Problem solved. And I have had Internet problems in many properties over the years, so this isnâ€™t an isolated incident. I was warned about problems with the elevators. There are two working elevators which are pretty old and somewhat slow. But they worked perfectly whenever I used them. Another issue was the ice machines. One didnâ€™t work, one worked sometimes, and one worked OK if you talked nice to it. Clearly, new machines are needed. When I reserved the room, the hotel had a pool available. When I arrived, the wall around the pool was completely smashed â€“ it looked like it was blown up! I later found out that during an intense thunderstorm a few days before we arrived, a Water Spout (small tornado) formed over the pool, sucking up all the water and smashing the wall, and several A/C units. I saw downed trees all over the area, so I knew something went on. So, while the pool was missed (especially on one hot day), I understood the situation. One negative thing was that the list of amenities found on various web sites is grossly incorrect. These show things like alarm clock, coffee maker, ironing board, hairdryer, refrigerator, newspaper, restaurant and bar. None of these amenities exist today. I donâ€™t really care, since I donâ€™t use these things, but the management should make sure that this information is accurate. The property does offer Continental breakfast, but it is minimal. In summary, the Skyview Plaza provided a reasonably pleasant stay. Positives include reasonable rates, close access to bus and subway, free parking, 24 hour diner across the street, a tremendous view of the Philly skyline from the upper floors and staff who were friendly and mostly helpful. The big negative is that maintenance of equipment in this 40 year old property has not been the best over the years and there are some issues with things not working. When checking in, check everything out and make sure you get a room with stuff that works. I got the feeling that the management is trying to turn this trend around, but it will take some time.

Reviews.Title: “best view of the city from the top”
Reviews.Author: sandy85_10
Reviews.Content: stay there, eat there and enjoy the view of the city late night as well as the early morning sun...

HotelInfo.Name: Skyview Plaza Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 2033 Penrose Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19145
